bibl.title: I.E. Spafford v. Territory of Washington King County. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle

body.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT,
Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the Counties of King and Kitsap.
HABEAS CORPUS. #5261
The People of the United States of America, to the Sheriff of King County Greeting:

We command you, that you have the body of I.E. Spafford by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever ame said I.E. Spafford shall be called or charged, before the HON. ROGER S. GREENE RICHARD A. JONES, judge of the aforesaid Court at 9 oclock A.M. on the 12th day of April 1887 to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said I.E. Spafford ----- And have you then and there this writ.
WITNESS THE HON. ROGER S. GREENE RICHARD A. JONES, Judge of said District Court, and the seal thereof this 11th day of April A.D. 1887
James Seavey, Clerk. By W.E. Ledgerwood, Deputy.
In the matter of the application of I.E. Spafford for a writ of Habeas Corpus
Writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED APRIL 12 1887
James Seavey, Clerk
Office of the Sheriff of King County } ss Washington Territory

I do hereby return to the Hon. Richard A. Jones Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Washingtong Territory that before to me of the within writ the said I.E. Spafford was committed to my custody, and is detained by virtue of another writ a copy of which is hereto annexed the original of which I also herewith produce. Nevertheless I have the body of the said I.E. Spafford before you at the hour day and place within mentioned as I am within commanded.
Dated at Seattle King County this 12th day of April 1887
William Cochrane Sheriff
By. M. Cadden
Sheriffs Fees Served Writ 1.00 Copy of Commit. .80 Transcript .20 Certificate .50 $2.50
M. 405 amended
In the matter of the Application } No. of I.E. Spafford for a Writ of Habeas Corpus

And now on this 12th day of April 1887, this cause coming on the be heard before the petition and the return of the Sheriff to the writ herefore issued herein; The said petitioner being present in person and by his attorneys R.S. Greene, and C.H. Hanford, and J.T. Ronald, presenting attorneys being also present, and appearing to the court from the statement of said presenting attorney that there is not sufficient no evidence to show probable cause to believe the said petitioner to be guilty of the offense alleged in the Writ of committment under which he is now held in imprisoned. Can be produced, and no evidence bring produced or official, in behalf of the territory, and no probable cause appearing, and said prosecuting attorney informing the court that he has no evidence to offer showing probable cause to believe the defendant guilty of said offense and the Court being now sufficiently adviced in the premises it is considered and adjudged by the court that said petitioner be and he is now hereby discharged from custody.
Dated April 12, 1887
Richard A. Jones Judge
FILED April 12, 1887 James Seavey, Clerk. W.E. Ledgerwood, Deputy Clerk.
